title: Code.org - Sprite Lab Lesson 2
subtitle: Picture Swap
excerpt: Learn how to use IF statements to make decisions, display messages with print statements, increase or decrease values using variables, swap images, keep track of counters, and add new assets.
content:
Picture Swap (Tutorial)

Tutorial

Let's learn how to work more with Event Blocks, Add Custom Sprites, Change the value of variable, Print out our changes, work with IF Conditional logic.

  1. In Code.org click New project + and select Sprite Lab. Then rename the project L2 Pict Swap

  2. From the Blocks toolbar select World and drag a set background to block under the when run block and change it to the rainbow background.

Video

  1. Over in the Stage/Canvas you should see the three tabs/buttons: Code, Costumes, Backgrounds.

  2. Select: Costumes

  3. In the Costumes menu click the New Costume button with giant plus + sign. This will open a pop-up with a bunch of extra sprites you can add.

  4. For this lesson in the search field type: arrow.

  5. In the results, click on the yellow right and left arrows. Clicking on one will put a checkbox over it. Once you selected both, click the purple done button in the bottom right of the popup.

  6. You should now see the right and left arrows available in the Costumes.

  7. Click back onto the Codebutton to the left of Costumes`.

Video

  1. From the Blocks toolbar select Sprites and add under the background the block make new sprite at. Change the sprite to the left arrow. Then click on the yellow block and position the arrow sprite towards the bottom left.

  2. Repeat the process for step 10 but choose the right arrow. Position this sprite in the bottom right.

Video

  1. In the Blocks toolbar select Variables. Click the Create Variable button. Name the variable page_number.

  2. Then back in Blocks > Variables drag the set page_number to block onto the Workspace and snap it under the right arrow.

  3. In the Blocks > Math toolbar find the 0 block and snap it to the end of the set page_number to block.

Video

  1. In the Blocks > Text toolbar drag the print block and snap it under the set page_number to block

  2. Back in the Blocks > Text toolbar grab the double-quotes block with puzzle connector on both sides and snap it to the print block. In this block type Page number: . Make sure there is a space after the colon.

  3. In the Blocks > Variable drag a copy of the page_number block with only a single side onto the Workspace and snap it against the right-side of the double-quotes block.

  4. Click the Run button to see the text display at the top with the variables value, currently set to 0.

Video

  1. From the Blocks > Events drag a when sprite clicked block onto the Workspace. Change the sprite to the left-arrow.

  2. Then from the Blocks > Variables drag and snap in a change page_number by block under the event block.

  3. In the Blocks > Math toolbar drag and snap in the 0 block to the end of the change page_number by block. Change the numeber form 0 to -1 (negative one)

  4. Now just like with the last row for the when run blocks. Copy that and past it under the change page_number by block.

[print] [Page number: ] [page_number]

  1. Click the Run button and click on the left-arrow. You should see the Page number at the top start decreasing.

Video

  1. Now let's repeat the steps for the left-arrow.

  2. What you will change is: Set sprite to the right arrow

  3. Change change page_number by number -1 to just 1 remove the minus sign.

  4. Click the Run button and click each arrow to see the number increase when you click the right arrow and decrease when you click the left arrow.

Video

Now let's learn about conditional logic also commonly referred to as if blocks.

  1. From the Blocks > Logic toolbar select if counter = [ ] empty block. Drag this block under the print block for the Right Arrow event.

  2. Click on the word counter in the if block and select page_number.

  3. From the Blocks > Math toolbar snap a 0 block inside the empty block space in the if block and change the number to 1.

  4. From the Blocks > World toolbar drag and snap a set background to block inside the if block. Change the background to the rainbow.

  5. If you click the Run button nothing will happen yet.

Video

  1. Under the if block add another if block where with variable = page_number and number set to 2. Then change the background to something else than the rainbow.

  2. Repeat this step once more with the if block. Set the variable to page_number. Set the number to 3. Change the background to something you are currently not using.

  3. Click the Run button. When clicking the left-arrow nothing happens. But when clicking the right-arrow you will see the pictures change when the page_number value is equal to the number set in the if block.

Video

  1. Duplicate exactly the three if blocks and place them under the left-arrow event print block.

  2. Now when you click the Run button you can navigate back and forth through the images by clicking either arrow.

Video
